intro: Trichophyllum simplex, commonly known as the small feather moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, finely branched stems that resemble feathers, hence its common name. This moss typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rock crevices. Its leaves are narrow and often recurved, with a smooth or slightly rough surface. Trichophyllum simplex plays an important ecological role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its habitat.
